wk1_r1.prompt_text: Propose a minimal early-game pacing nudge that uses existing systems (bounties/lairs/spawner) and is deterministic.

response.raw:
### Status
Completed implementation of the wk1 plan’s minimal early-game pacing nudge using existing systems (HUD + bounties + lairs) and sim-time (determinism-friendly).

### Deliverables
- Early pacing nudge implementation: `game/engine.py`
  - Shows a HUD bounty tip (~35s sim-time) if the player hasn’t placed any bounties
  - At ~90s sim-time, optionally auto-places a starter `attack_lair` bounty on the nearest lair if the player placed none and can afford it (charges via `EconomySystem.add_bounty`; reward uses `LAIR_BOUNTY_COST`)
- Doc note tying this to scenarios: `docs/scenarios.md`

### Questions
- None.

### Next actions
- Optional: add a config/CLI toggle to disable/force the nudge for QA/tuning.

### Handoff checklist
- Files changed: `game/engine.py`, `docs/scenarios.md`
- How to test: run `python main.py --no-llm` (or `--provider mock`), don’t place any bounties; observe HUD tip ~35s and starter lair bounty ~90s; confirm gold decreases by bounty amount; place a manual bounty before 90s to confirm auto-bounty never triggers.
